title: Screaming for ice cream
name: Screaming for ice cream
description:
A Map by Vancouverpapers

The Vancouver Sun's Mia Stainsby has a few favourite places for ice cream and gelato – sixteen, to be exact.  This map shows where they are.

properties.name: AMATO GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers78 East First Ave., Vancouver, B.C., CanadaA super-sized gelato parlour with some 50 flavours offered. The hedgehog gelato is the most popular here although when I visited some time ago, I spied a blue Viagra gelato. (Fake, of course.)

properties.name: BC GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1102 West Broadway, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaGuiseppe Molinari makes the gelato in small batches with all-natural ingredients. They\'re proud of their pistachio gelato. Lunch offered as well.

properties.name: BELLAGIO'S GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers3075 Main St., Vancouver, B.C., CanadaSet in a space-agey setting with 360-degree circular gelato showcase, displaying more than 72 flavours, going up to 96 very soon. The chocolate gelato uses a 90-per-cent chocolate product; an intense experience.

properties.name: BRAZZA ON LONSDALE
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1846 Lonsdale Ave., North Vancouver, B.C., CanadaA coffee shop and gelato bar. About 48 flavours on the go.

properties.name: Crossings Gelato Cafe and Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers 20167 - 96th Ave., Langley, B.C., CanadaTry the Schmirnoff Ice, Budweiser or Beaver Buzz (energy) flavours. Or ask for two shots of espresso over your gelato. (Eat with speed.) House-made wafer cones.

properties.name: DOLCE 67
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers3790 Hastings St, Burnaby, B.C., CanadaFormer champ car Atlantic racer Marc De Vellis opened this friendly coffee shop/gelato bar when his contract expired a couple of years ago. His favourites? Ferrero Rocher. Lemon. Hazelnut.

properties.name: DOLCE AMORE
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1590 Commercial Dr., Vancouver, B.C., CanadaRun by the Grippo family. Daughter Nicoletta teaches gelato-making around the world. They\'ll mix flavours in one scoop if you ask. Forty-four flavours from a rotation of 100. They also serve the very Italian afogato (espresso over gelato).

properties.name: LA CASA GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1033 Venables St., Vancouver, B.C., CanadaThe king of gelato, Vince Misceo and family offer 218 flavours daily from a repertoire of 600. Many of the flavours are for the adventurous only.

properties.name: MARBLE SLAB CREAMERY
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers20159 88th Ave, Langley, B.C., CanadaA franchise operation. Six to 7 ounces of "mix-ins" like chocolate bar bites, fresh fruit, candies, nuts are melded into your ice cream with a paddle on a frozen marble slab.

properties.name: MARBLE SLAB CREAMERY
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1184 Denman St, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaA franchise operation. Six to 7 ounces of "mix-ins" like chocolate bar bites, fresh fruit, candies, nuts are melded into your ice cream with a paddle on a frozen marble slab.

properties.name: MARINA'S GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers11968 - 224th St., Maple Ridge, B.C., CanadaRun by a former pastry chef and son of a Dutch gelato maker. Temptations include dolce latte, Bailey\'s, Mozart (giandula and pistachio), and cookie gelato.

properties.name: MATTEO'S GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers2615 Mary Hill Rd., Port Coquitlam, B.C., CanadaUnlimited free samplings. In fact, staff encourage a minimum of tastings before ordering. Some 42 flavours. The shop is a former English tea garden and has a big outdoor patio.

properties.name: MONDO GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers4151 Hazelbridge Way, Richmond, B.C., CanadaThe owner also owns a marble company and operates Mondo Gelato shops in Rome, Beijing, San Diego and Hawaii. Some 50 flavours from a rotation of 150.

properties.name: MONDO GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1094 Denman St, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaThe owner also owns a marble company and operates Mondo Gelato shops in Rome, Beijing, San Diego and Hawaii. Some 50 flavours from a rotation of 150.

properties.name: MONDO GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1222 Robson St,, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaThe owner also owns a marble company and operates Mondo Gelato shops in Rome, Beijing, San Diego and Hawaii. Some 50 flavours from a rotation of 150.

properties.name: MUM'S GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers855 Denman, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaFood TV\'s Rachael Ray visited in 2006, for Mum\'s 15 minutes of fame. She called it the best gelato in town. Ownership has changed but Mum\'s has been going since 1979. Popular flavours are pistachio, chocolate, mocha, lemon sorbetto.

properties.name: SHASHUKA
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers6555 Fraser St, Vancouver, B.C., CanadaIt\'s an odd spot -- an art gallery and Mediterranean restaurant. Best of all, though, is the gelato bar at the entrance. The cherry gelato is delicious. Some 36 flavours in all.

properties.name: TEMPTATIONS GELATO
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers103 - 450 East Columbia, New Westminster, B.C., CanadaDoctors and nurses from the Royal Columbian Hospital a couple blocks away keep their cool with gelato from here. Blood orange, Belgian chocolate top the charts. Coffee shop food sold here as well.

properties.name: YALETOWN GELATO ESPRESSO BAR
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers 1210 Homer St., Vancouver, B.C., CanadaThree brothers -- Salvatore, Saverio and Massimiliano (Max) Gallo -- run the place. Their signature gelatos are toasted marshmallow and apple pie (with apples and baked crust crumbled into it). They also have afogato and ubriaco or "drunken gelato" with a pour of vodka, Limoncello, Frangelico or other booze.
